title: Node Tree Has Positive Size
description:
Prove that a tree constructed with `Node` has a size of at least 1.

**Goal:** `forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l r : tree A), 1 <= size (Node x l r)`

The `size` function counts the total number of nodes in a tree. A `Node` always contributes at least 1 to the size.
hints: Start with `intros` to introduce all variables
Use `simpl` to unfold the definition of `size` on `Node x l r`
The result reduces to showing `1 <= 1 + (size l + size r)` â€” use `lia` or basic arithmetic lemmas
prelude:
Require Import Arith.
Require Import Lia.

Inductive tree (A : Type) : Type :=
  | Leaf : tree A
  | Node : A -> tree A -> tree A -> tree A.

Arguments Leaf {A}.
Arguments Node {A} _ _ _.

Fixpoint size {A : Type} (t : tree A) : nat :=
  match t with
  | Leaf => 0
  | Node _ l r => 1 + size l + size r
  end.
